intro: Eriophyllum idoneum, commonly known as the slender goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits called achenes. Eriophyllum idoneum is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
